Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Can't upload package, says Package name reserved." (#7930) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Hi,
i'm trying to upload package using "Upload" button at https://www.nuget.org/packages/upload, but i'm receiving "The package ID 'NetCore.DependencyInjection.Modules' is not available.". I checked that package name - it not used at nuget gallery.

Can you help me with this?

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[Rename] DB schema change" (#7923) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: The DB schema change for renaming package. Handle issue: https://github.com/nuget/nugetgallery/issues/7900 **NEW** Query generated to update the DB schema (with the timestamp): > CREATE TABLE [dbo].[PackageRenames] ( [Key] [int] NOT NULL IDENTITY, [FromPackageRegistrationKey] [int] NOT NULL, [ToPackageRegistrationKey] [int] NOT NULL, [TransferPopularity] [bit] NOT NULL, [UpdatedOn] [datetime] NOT NULL DEFAULT GETUTCDATE(), CONSTRAINT [PK_dbo.PackageRenames] PRIMARY KEY ([Key]) ) CREATE UNIQUE INDEX [IX_FromPackageRegistrationKey_ToPackageRegistrationKey] ON [dbo].[PackageRenames]([FromPackageRegistrationKey], [ToPackageRegistrationKey]) CREATE INDEX [IX_TransferPopularity] ON [dbo].[PackageRenames]([TransferPopularity]) ALTER TABLE [dbo].[PackageRegistrations] ADD [RenamedMessage] [nvarchar](max) ALTER TABLE [dbo].[PackageRenames] ADD CONSTRAINT [FK_dbo.PackageRenames_dbo.PackageRegistrations_FromPackageRegistrationKey] FOREIGN KEY ([FromPackageRegistrationKey]) REFERENCES [dbo].[PackageRegistrations] ([Key]) ON DELETE CASCADE ALTER TABLE [dbo].[PackageRenames] ADD CONSTRAINT [FK_dbo.PackageRenames_dbo.PackageRegistrations_ToPackageRegistrationKey] FOREIGN KEY ([ToPackageRegistrationKey]) REFERENCES [dbo].[PackageRegistrations] ([Key]) **NEW** DB schema change (with the timestamp): Note that there are two foreign keys on "PackageRenames" table which point to the same "PackageRegistrations" table, we have to disable one of the cascade deletion and delete the reference entities in the "Delete package registration" command.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[A11y]On 'T' key press in scan mode, Narrator is reading as "table with 0 rows and 0 columns" even though there are no tables" (#7891) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Copied from https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1069945
Repro Steps:​
1.Start Screen Reader. Hit the URL "https://www.nuget.org" and sign in with valid credentials​
2.Tab till "Sign In" link in the top navigation and press enter​
3.Tab till "Sign in with Microsoft" button and press enter​
4.Select valid user id and press enter​
5.Enter any Username, tab till "Register" button and press enter​
6.Tab till the user menu button and press enter to expand it. Select "Manage Packages" and press enter​
7.Tab till "Published Packages", expand it and select any existing package.(If no packages are available, add a new package)​
8.Tab till "Manage Package" link under "Info" and press enter​
9.Turn on scan mode for Narrator by pressing Caps lock + Space bar
10.Now press 'T' key and check the Narrator behavior ​
​
Actual Result:​
On 'T' key press in scan mode, Narrator is reading as "table with 0 rows and 0 columns" even though there are no tables
​
NOTE: NVDA is working as expected(added attachment for reference)

Expected Result:​
On 'T' key press in scan mode, Narrator should read as "no next table" when there are no tables on the page
​
Notes:
Couldn't get scan mode working without exploding my browser. I am unsure of why a table is being read out. I suspect there is a table somewhere hidden that is being fed into the narrator.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[A11y]Narrator is not reading the heading "Deprecation" on 'H' key press in scan mode " (#7890) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Copied from https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1069941
Repro Steps:​
1.Start Screen Reader. Hit the URL "https://www.nuget.org" and sign in with valid credentials​
2.Tab till "Sign In" link in the top navigation and press enter​
3.Tab till "Sign in with Microsoft" button and press enter​
4.Select valid user id and press enter​
5.Enter any Username, tab till "Register" button and press enter​
6.Tab till the user menu button and press enter to expand it. Select "Manage Packages" and press enter​
7.Tab till "Published Packages", expand it and select any existing package.(If no packages are available, add a new package)​
8.Tab till "Manage Package" link under "Info" and press enter​
9.Turn on scan mode for Narrator by pressing Caps lock + Space bar
10.Now press 'H' key and check if narrator focus is navigating to headings (Deprecation) on the page​
​
Actual Result:​
Narrator is not reading the heading "Deprecation" on 'H' key press in scan mode
​
NOTE: NVDA is working as expected(added attachment for reference)

Expected Result:​
Narrator should read the headings on 'H' key press in scan mode

Notes:
I wasn't able to get scan mode working without crashing my browser. I suspect that it is simply missing an attribute that is on the other headings.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[A11y]When the focus is on "Provide custom message" text-box, Narrator focus is shifting to "S" letter of "Save" button" (#7893) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Copied from https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1069923
Repro Steps:​
1.Start Screen Reader. Hit the URL "https://www.nuget.org" and sign in with valid credentials​
2.Tab till "Sign In" link in the top navigation and press enter​
3.Tab till "Sign in with Microsoft" button and press enter​
4.Select valid user id and press enter​
5.Enter any Username, tab till "Register" button and press enter​
6.Tab till the user menu button and press enter to expand it. Select "Manage Packages" and press enter​
7.Tab till "Published Packages", expand it and select any existing package.(If no packages are available, add a new package)​
8.Tab till "Manage Package" link under "Info" and press enter​
9.Tab till "Deprecation" section and press enter to expand it​
10.Tab till "Provide custom message" text-box and check if the Narrator focus is on the same​
​
Actual Result:​
When the focus is on "Provide custom message" text-box, Narrator focus is shifting to "S" letter of "Save" button and it is reading as "Provide Custom Message - Edit - Test Deletion - Cap S"
​
NOTE: NVDA is reading "Provide custom message" text box correctly

Expected Result:​
When the focus is on "Provide custom message" text-box, Narrator focus  should be on the same text box and it should only read "Provide Custom Message - Edit - Test Deletion"

Notes:
I was unable to reproduce this. Focus went in to the textbox as expected. Let's verify again that this is behaving as expected and then close it out.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "UseStaticGraphEvaluation results in item not being expanded inside property" (#9398) at NuGet/Home
Opened issue "Feature Request: Match assemblies to nuget packages." (#9397) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
As a devops consultant I'm often brought in to help clients to brush up their old code bases, migrate them to newer technologies, lean out their repositories etc. 

In these quests I often stumble upon folders with a gazillion binaries. Worst case randomly thrown together in a big folder. One of my clients has about 1.7GB in external dependencies in their TFVC repo. I'd like to get rid of that as part of the migration.

Ideally I'd move the bulk of these dependencies to nuget packages, remove as many transient ones as possible and purge them prior to moving the client to git.

The little-known `T:some-type-in-assembly` query API is helpful, but it doesn't help me find the right version of the package. it may also give me a lot of options to choose from. 

Ideally I'd pass in a fully-qualified-assembly-name, that should narrow down the selection substantially. From there it would be much easier to compute the direct and transient dependencies and update the project files accordingly.

# My proposal

Add a `A:AssemblyName` query API that will return all nuget packages that contain this assembly.

```
A:Microsoft.ServiceBus, Version=3.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35
|
+- windowsazure.servicebus.4.1.11

# Alternatively, let me pass a hash of a file and use that.

# Looks like I'm not alone in this desire.

https://twitter.com/jessehouwing/status/1246150174654828550

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Add interop API to enumerate fallback folders without requiring a solution/project" (#9395) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Environment Details
NuGet product used: VS UI
NuGet version: 5.6.0.6489
VS version: 16.7
Worked before?: No

## Feature Request
NuGet settings can be set in the following locations:
- machine-wide (%ProgramFiles(x86)%\NuGet\Config\\*.config)
- user-specific (%APPDATA%\NuGet\NuGet.config)
- solution-wide

The XAML and WinForms teams need an API to enumerate machine-wide and user-specific fallback folders that:
1. Works without requiring a solution to be open
2. Ignores solution-wide settings if a solution is loaded

In order to call this API from within VS, it needs to be an interop API.

Likely choices to support from NuGet according to @rrelyea:
1. Tweak existing VS interop API to allow null value (or similar) to get what you need. Note that the requirement to ignore solution config when a solution is open may make this option impossible.
2. Add a new VS interop API.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "NuGet should support multiple config files in %APPDATA%\NuGet directory" (#9394) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem
NuGet product used: VS UI
NuGet version: 5.6.0.6489
VS version: 16.7
Worked before?: No

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem
1. Unzip [SomeOther.zip](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/files/4430294/SomeOther.zip)
2. Place SomeOther.config in %APPDATA%\NuGet. This config file declares a single package source named "IssueRepro"
3. Start VS and open/create some project
4. Open NuGet Package Manager
5. Expand "Package source" combo box

**Expected:** IssueRepro source is one of the options.

**Actual:** IssueRepro source is not shown as an option.

**Workarounds**:
1. Place the file in %ProgramFiles(x86)%\NuGet\Config instead. 
1. Merge the IssueRepro package source into %APPDATA%\NuGet\NuGet.Config's list of package sources.

Note that what I really care about is fallback folders, but I'm using package sources for ease of repro.

## Reasoning
The XAML and WinForms teams want to allow control library installers to add user-specific NuGet fallback folders by having their SDK installers drop config files in %APPDATA%\NuGet. On uninstall this file would be deleted.

We considered two alternatives which I mentioned as workarounds above:
1. Require SDK installers to drop config files in %ProgramFiles(x86)%\NuGet\Config instead. However, we've gotten feedback from control vendors that they would like the option of installing without elevation which prevents the installer from being able to write to this directory.
2. Require SDK installers to modify the one %APPDATA%\NuGet\NuGet.config file. However this seems error prone.

@rrelyea @zivkan @aortiz-msft @mgoertz-msft

Events.RelatedBody:
## nuget restore does not restore content files

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe): nuget.exe

NuGet version (x.x.x.xxx): 5.4.0

OS version (i.e. win10 v1607 (14393.321)): Win Server 2019

This bug ruins our CI/CD because my web project's `/Scripts` folder and similar JavaScript/Css/images stuff is not being copied during deploy!

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "dotnet nuget push globbing works inconsistently across environments" (#9390) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem
From a Docs issue https://github.com/dotnet/docs/issues/7146 

Behavior for `*.nupkg` doesn't work properly in Unix environments. @heng-liu discovered that quotes are required, such as `'*.nupkg'`, in order for push to behave as expected:  https://github.com/dotnet/docs/issues/7146#issuecomment-607566832

@zivkan commented very clearly why this happens (Unix parses the glob, then sends a list through the CLI, but NuGet doesn't accept such list): https://github.com/dotnet/docs/issues/7146#issuecomment-608629024

Windows works as expected in dotnet **3.1.300-preview-015048**.
Both push all expected packages (not just 1):
`dotnet nuget push *\**\*.nupkg --source "nugettest" --skip-duplicate`
`dotnet nuget push *\*\*\*.nupkg --source "nugettest" --skip-duplicate`

We need to make this experience consistent across environments. Some investigative work should be done first to understand whether we should accept an expanded list from Unix, or require quotes around wildcard searches.

#### Setup
NuGet product used: dotnet.exe
dotnet.exe --version (if appropriate):  3.1.300-preview-015048
OS version (i.e. win10 v1607 (14393.321)): Windows / Ubuntu
Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version: Nope, not as of dotnet 2.1.302

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

```
henli@henli001UbuntuRepro:~/packages$ dotnet --version
2.1.302
henli@henli001UbuntuRepro:~/packages$ dotnet nuget push --source ~/source/ *.nupkg
info : Pushing project1.1.0.0.nupkg to '/home/henli/source/'...
info : Your package was pushed.
henli@henli001UbuntuRepro:~/packages$ dotnet nuget push --source ~/source/ '*.nupkg'
info : Pushing project1.1.0.0.nupkg to '/home/henli/source/'...
info : Your package was pushed.
info : Pushing project2.1.0.0.nupkg to '/home/henli/source/'...
info : Your package was pushed.
```

## Other suggested things

Xplat testing should be added to verify push works similarly on multiple environments.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Deprecating TLS 1.0 and 1.1 on NuGet.org – Stage 1" (#42) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
## NuGet.org will temporarily remove support for TLS 1.0/1.1 on February 26, 2020

We plan to temporarily remove support for TLS 1.0/1.1 across 3 time slots in a 24 hour period, for 4 hours each, to ensure overlap with normal working hours across the globe. If you discover that you are impacted and cannot identify a workaround, please open an issue on the NuGet Gallery GitHub repo.

Read this blog post to learn more and to identify the test slot time in your time zone - https://devblogs.microsoft.com/nuget/deprecating-tls-1-0-and-1-1-on-nuget-org-stage-1/
